properties.title: Azure Virtual Desktop - Replacement Plans Deployment

elements.name: sessionHostsCount
elements.label: Target Session Host Count
elements.toolTip: The target number of session hosts in the host pool.

elements.name: sessionHostNamePrefix
elements.label: Session Host Name Prefix
elements.toolTip: The prefix for the session host names. The session host names will be in the format <prefix>-<number>.

constraints.validationMessage: Must be a valid name less than 12 characters long to allow for the 3 character suffix (eg. prefix-01).

elements.name: TemplateParameters
elements.label: Template Parameters
elements.toolTip: The parameters to pass to the template at deployment time. Use json format.

elements.name: EntraJoined
elements.label: Session hosts are Entra Joined (Azure AD Joined)
elements.toolTip: If the session hosts are Entra Joined, Replacement Plan will attempt to delete its device object from Entra ID. This requires additional permissions to be granted to the service principal used by Replacement Plan. Please refer to the documentation for more information.

options.text: When the VMs are Entra Joined, Replacement Plan will attempt to delete its device object from Entra ID. This requires additional permissions to be granted to the service principal used by Replacement Plan. Please refer to the documentation for more information.

elements.name: _Tag_IncludeInAutomation
elements.label: Include in Automation Tag Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the tag to use to determine if an existing session host should be included in the automation. After deployment, if the tag is present and set to 'true', the session host will be included. If the tag is not present or set to 'false', the session host will be excluded.

elements.name: _Tag_DeployTimestamp
elements.label: Deploy Timestamp Tag Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the tag to use to determine when the session host was deployed. This is updated by the replacement plan function on new session hosts. After deployment, you can edit the value of this tag to force replace a VM.

elements.name: _Tag_PendingDrainTimestamp
elements.label: Pending Drain Timestamp Tag Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the tag to use to determine when the session host was marked for drain. This is updated by the replacement plan function on hosts pending deletion.

elements.name: _Tag_ScalingPlanExclusionTag
elements.label: Scaling Plan Exclusion Tag Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the tag Replacement Plan will set to exclude a session host from scaling plans actions.

elements.name: _TargetVMAgeDays
elements.label: Target VM Age (Days)
elements.toolTip: The maximum age of a VM in days before it is replaced. This is compared to the value of the Deploy Timestamp Tag.

elements.name: _DrainGracePeriodHours
elements.label: Drain Grace Period (Hours)
elements.toolTip: The number of hours to wait after marking a VM for drain before deleting it. This is to allow users to finish their sessions before the VM is deleted.

elements.name: _FixSessionHostTags
elements.label: Fix Existing Session Host Tags
elements.toolTip: If enabled, the replacement plan will fix the tags on existing session hosts or if tags are mistakenly deleted. The tag values will NOT allow deletion of existing session hosts and must be changed post deployment. This is useful if you are deploying a new replacement plan to an existing host pool.

elements.name: _SHRDeploymentPrefix
elements.label: Deployment Prefix
elements.toolTip: The prefix of the deployment created in the session hosts resource group when replacement VMs are deploying. This is used to track running and failed deployments.

elements.name: _AllowDownsizing
elements.label: Allow Downsizing
elements.toolTip: If enabled, the replacement plan will delete older session hosts when the total number of good hosts is higher than target session host number.

elements.name: _SessionHostInstanceNumberPadding
elements.label: Session Host VM Name Padding
elements.toolTip: The number of digits to pad the session host instance number with. For example, if the value is 3, the session host names will be in the format <prefix>-001.

elements.name: _AllowDownsizing
elements.label: Allow Downsizing
elements.toolTip: If enabled, the replacement plan will delete older session hosts when the total number of good hosts is higher than target session host number.

elements.name: _ReplaceSessionHostOnNewImageVersion
elements.label: Replace Session Hosts On New Image Version
elements.toolTip: (Recommended) If enabled, the replacement plan will replace session hosts when a new image version is available. This works for both marketplace and custom images. If disabled, the replacement plan will only replace session hosts when the VM age is greater than the target VM age.

elements.name: _ReplaceSessionHostOnNewImageVersionDelayDays
elements.label: Replace on New Image Version Delay (Days)
elements.toolTip: The number of days to wait after a new image is available before replacing session hosts. This is to allow time for the image to be tested before replacing session hosts.

elements.name: _VMNamesTemplateParameterName
elements.label: VM Names Template Parameter Name
elements.toolTip: The name of the parameter in the template that specifies the VM Names array.

elements.name: _SessionHostResourceGroupName
elements.label: Session Hosts Resource Group Name
elements.toolTip: Leave this empty to deploy to same resource group as the host pool.
